date.headline: Bitcoin announced
date.text: Satoshi Nakamoto posted a paper to the Cryptography Mailing List, described Bitcoin as “a new electronic cash system that's fully peer-to-peer, with no trusted third party.”

date.headline: First bitcoin client released
date.text: Bitcoin 0.1.10 alpha release went live on sourceforge for download. It was accompanied by perhaps the first discussion of how bitcoins should be valued.

date.headline: First bitcoin transaction takes place.
date.text: The first transaction was between Satoshi Nakamoto and Hal Finney. It was in block 170 and for a total amount of 100 BTC.

date.headline: Bitcoin Market – first exchange – is founded
date.text: It laid the foundation for the current system of exchanges, but is no longer around today. Early troubles with Paypal payment fraud didn't help it along.

date.headline: First real-world goods purchased
date.text: $25 worth of pizza was purchased by Lazlo for 10,000 BTC from Jercos. At today's exchange rate, that would be a $1.2M USD pizza.

date.headline: MtGox is established
date.text: Initially established as a trading card exchange, Mt Gox is, as of September 2013, the largest bitcoin exchange by volume of trade.

date.headline: Bitcoin reaches parity with the US Dollar
date.text: Based on the MtGox rate, 1BTC = $1USD for the first time. At the time there were approximately 5.3 Million BTC in circulation.

date.headline: Tibanne Co.Ltd. purchases MtGox from Jed Macleb
date.text: McCaleb was previously known as the developer of the software eDonkey. He has since founded a competing digital currency, Ripple, run by his company OpenCoin.

date.headline: Bitcoin user survives 3 month road trip on bitcoin alone
date.text: Bitcoin user Plato travels coast-to-coast in the US between April & June 2011 using only bitcoin. No record was kept of how many cans of baked beans he ate.

date.headline: Time features Bitcoin
date.text: The first major press spotlight on bitcoin, read the article here. It came out in the wake of Paypal freezing payments to WikiLeaks.

date.headline: First Bitcoin iPad application released
date.text: Developer Intervex Digital releases Bitcoins Mobile app for iPad. The app is still available on the App store.

date.headline: Bitcoin Foundation established
date.text: Its mission is to help people exchange resources and ideas more freely. To that end, it aims to standardize, protect and promote the use of Bitcoin.

date.headline: Wordpress.com accepts bitcoins as payment
date.text: The first major company to accept Bitcoin, it was largely as a pro-freedom measure in the wake of the Paypal WikiLeaks freeze.

date.headline: First Bitcoin exchange licensed as a bank in Europe
date.text: Bitcoin-Central.net is licensed by European regulators. It plans to issue debit cards and work with existing bank networks.

date.headline: MtGox Exchange rate nears nearly $32 USD
date.text: Previous peak was June 8 2011 at 31.91USD on MtGox.

date.headline: Total Bitcoin market cap passes $1 billion USD
date.text: As the price passed $95 USD, the total BTC market cap hit $1 billion USD. Press coverage here.

date.headline: Bitcoin price surpasses 1BTC / $100 USD
date.text: Making that 10,000 BTC pizza a million dollar pizza.
